intro: Psychotria jugalis, commonly known as the red-eyed wonder, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers with white markings, which are borne on slender, erect stems. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy texture, often with a dark green color. Psychotria jugalis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant due to its vibrant appearance.
